meanings.definition: A comparison between two things, typically for the purpose of explanation or clarification.
meanings.sent1: She used analogies to explain the complex scientific concept to her students.
meanings.sent2: The teacher often uses analogies to help students understand difficult topics.
meanings.sent3: The analogy comparing the brain to a computer made everyone chuckle in class.
meanings.sent4: Her analogy of life being like a rollercoaster struck a chord with the audience.
meanings.sent5: The analogy of the human body as a machine was both insightful and memorable.

meanings.definition: A correspondence or partial similarity between two things.
meanings.sent1: The analogy between the two paintings was striking.
meanings.sent2: There was an interesting analogy between the characters in the two novels.
meanings.sent3: The analogy of the cat chasing its tail made the children giggle.
meanings.sent4: The analogy of time as a river flowing endlessly was poetic.
meanings.sent5: The analogy of friendship as a garden needing care resonated with everyone.
